edu.ucsf.MESS

Class MESSLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsf.MESS.MESSLauncher

  • public class MESSLauncher
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements multivariate environmental similarity surfaces (MESS) following Elith et al, 2010, The art of modelling range-shifting species, Methods in Ecology and Evolution, 1:330-342.
    Author:
    Joshua Ladau, jladau@gmail.com

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] rgsArgs)
        Writes rasters with MESS values for input rasters and a set of samples.
        Parameters:
        Arguments - pass as --{argument name}={argument value}. Name-value pairs are:

        Required arguments

        • sOutputPath [string] = Absolute path for output file. Output is in NetCDF format and should have a ".nc" suffix.

        • sSelectedModelsPath [string] = Path of output file from ModelSelector.

        • sResponseVar [string] = Name of response variable being modeled (e.g., 'Richness', 'Shannon', or the name of specific taxon).

        Optional arguments

        • sSampleMetadataPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Path to text file containing sample metadata formatted according to http://biom-format.org/documentation/adding_metadata.html. For use if BIOM file does not contain metadata. Must include 'id', 'datetime' and 'latitude', 'longitude' or 'x','y' fields

        • sSamplesToKeepPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Path to file with list of samples to keep. File should contain a list of sample names, one per line.

        • sObservationsToKeepPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Path to file with list of observations to keep. File should contain a list of observation names.

        • bCheckRarefied [boolean] [OPTIONAL] = Flag for whether to check for rarefaction. If enabled and table is not rarefied, error will be thrown. Default is true.

        • iRarefactionTotal [integer] [OPTIONAL] = Total count to which to rarefy samples.

        • sMaskPath [string] [OPTIONAL] = Absolute path to shapefile used for masking MESS maps.

        • sMaskFeature [string] [OPTIONAL] = Name of header for feature to use in masking MESS maps.

        • sMaskFeatureID [string] [OPTIONAL] = Name of feature to use for masking MESS maps.

        • sTrainingDate [string] [OPTIONAL] = Date (YYYY-MM-DD) of training data. If this argument is unspecified, date of sample collection is used.

        • dTrainingVert [double] [OPTIONAL] = Elevation of training data. Defaults to 0.

        • rgtProjectionTimes [list of dates] [OPTIONAL] = Comma-delimited list of of times to project to. Times should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Use 9999 if no year is specified (e.g., 9999-7-15). Omit if all environmental rasters are not temporally resolved.

        • rgdProjectionVerts [list of doubles] [OPTIONAL] = Comma-delimited list of of elevations to project to. Defaults to 0. Omit if all environmental rasters are not elevation-specific.

        • bOutputMap [boolean] [OPTIONAL] = Flag for whether to write MESS maps. Defaults to true.

        • bOutputTable [boolean] [OPTIONAL] = Flag for whether to write table giving the fraction of non-error area greater than MESS -20 for each variable. Defaults to false.

        • rgsProjectionTimeIntervals [list of strings] [OPTIONAL] = Time intervals to project to. For use when projecting to another time period, but rasters for different time periods are stored in separate variables. Intervals should be listed in the form YYYY-MM-DD--YYYY-MM-DD. Training climatology will always be included.
